::: contentWrapper
# Product Disposal Information {#product-disposal-information .title}

[](javascript:window.print() "Print this article"){.printArticle
aria-label="Print this Article"}

::: sections
To properly dispose of any DDL product once it reaches its end of life,
check your local authority for recycling advice and facilities.

The separate collection and recycling of your product at the time of
disposal will help conserve natural resources and ensure that it is
recycled in a manner that protects human health and the environment.
:::

------------------------------------------------------------------------

::: sections
[United
States](https://www.epa.gov/smm-electronics/regulations-initiatives-and-research-electronics-stewardship){target="_blank"}

[US Environmental Protection
Agency](http://www.epa.gov/){target="_blank"}

[State Electronics
Laws](http://www.electronicsrecycling.org/?page_id=37){target="_blank"}

-Twenty-five states currently have electronics recycling laws. The
National Center for Electronics Recycling (NCER) developed [an
interactive
map](http://www.ecycleclearinghouse.org/content.aspx?pageid=10) that
helps to find out detailed information on state regulations, including a
brief summary and link to the laws as well as key dates.
:::
